input_full.title: Proof toggle: Lean code jumping/flickering during animation
input_full.body:
## Problem

When clicking proof toggle on any page, the Lean code jumps around its box during the animation. It always ends up in the correct final state, but the transition is visually jarring.

**Behavior:**
- Happens 100% of the time on all proof toggles, all pages
- All Lean code (signature and proof body) jumps vertically during animation
- LaTeX proof toggle on the same page works smoothly without jumping

## Root Cause Investigation

The problematic callback was added in commit `2063d35` (fix for issue #175 "one-line gap"):
```javascript
sbsContainer.find('.lean-proof-body').slideDown(300, function() {
    $(this).css('display', 'inline');
});
```

The working version before that commit used `slideUp()`/`slideDown()` without callbacks.

## Attempted Fixes

1. **CSS transitions with max-height**: Added transition styles, but caused horizontal layout issues during animation (proof body appeared to the right instead of below)
2. **Restored pre-regression code**: Removed the callback and used simple `slideUp()`/`slideDown()`, but flickering persists

## Related Issue: Styling Unification

Paper pages should use the same [show]/[hide] text proof toggle styling as blueprint pages, not the modern button style. Added `.ar5iv-paper` overrides to `paper.css` but modern styling still appears.

## Files Involved

- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/plastex.js` (lines 69-85)
- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/common.css` (lines 432-436)
- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/blueprint.css` (lines 1350-1406)
- `toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/paper.css` (end of file)
- `toolchain/Dress/Dress/Render/SideBySide.lean` (HTML structure)

## Expected Behavior

Lean proof body should animate smoothly like the LaTeX proof content - no jumping, no flickering, just a clean slide animation.
